data.title: "Rotation" instead of "rotation"
data.body:
As I saved a previous mission with the 3.9 build I noticed in my version control that in the mission file every "rotation" was changed into "Rotation" but it should be "rotation" since all other settings are starting with small letters as well.
I could not find where this is done, but this should be undone.

data.title: Normal maps broken
data.body:
It looks like normal maps on terrain are broken, when I add them nothing changes, instead there is ugly graphic artifacts:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_TG_DirtPit_day001-00001.png

I noticed it is not only on terrain but on other shapes as well, producing similar graphic artifactsm, the normal maps do something, but it does not look right.

data.title: No specular on decals
data.body:
The 3.9 update broke specular on decals, it is completely gone.
Here is an example from stock T3D , left side mesh road, right side decal road, I enabled on both sides simple pixel specular with full power, but on the right side it is gone:
http://duion.com/files/temp/screenshot_001-decalspecular.png
When the decal road starts it shows specular for a short distance, but then goes away, maybe it is moved under the terrain and because of that does not show specular.
Specular is broken on all other decals as well it seems.

data.title: Specular sliders broken
data.body:
Before the 3.9 update it was possible to adjust the specular strengths with those sliders in the material editor, but it no longer works if you are using a specular map, it only works if you use the pixel specular checkbox in case you don't want to use a specular map.
But the pixel specular feature is very rarely used since it is not a nice solution.
I also have the suspicion that those sliders and values now work very different than before.

http://duion.com/files/temp/3.9_specularbroken.png

The first slider which goes from 1-128 was first that 1 meant highest specularity and 128 lowest, now it seems to be the other way around, but only if you don't use a specular map as stated before, if using a texture it does not work at all.

data.title: filename collision problem with .zip virtual directories
data.body:
I have a folder with the following:

struct.dae
struct.dae.zip (which also contains a file named struct.dae).

If I attempt to load struct.dae from that directory, it appears to find the struct.dae.zip first and think it's an actual directory and fail to load the correct file. However, I can ask it to load "struct.dae/struct.dae" via the virtual directory support, and it will load the version contained in the zip file.

data.title: Unable to create a physicsshape datablock from datablock editor.
data.body:
Unable to create a physicsshape datablock from datablock editor.

```
<input> (0): preload failed for myTestPS: PhysicsShapeData::preload - No shape name defined..
tools/datablockEditor/datablockEditor.cs (716): Unable to find object: 'myTestPS' attempting to call function 'getId'
tools/datablockEditor/datablockEditor.cs (193): Unable to find object: '' attempting to call function 'getClassName'
tools/datablockEditor/datablockEditor.cs (201): Unable to find object: '' attempting to call function 'getId'
tools/datablockEditor/datablockEditor.cs (504): Unable to find object: '' attempting to call function 'getId'
Set::remove: Object "" does not exist in set
```

VS2015+Bullet+Windows7
tested in last commit 5fa8504568871e227c557a6a584f487b3bbce29f

data.title: Basic OpenVR Support code
data.body:
Adds basic OpenVR support. This also includes support for rendering controllers based on OpenVR data, though this is as of yet incomplete as there are no hooks for the button input.

Much like the oculus support, a script is also provided to handle setting up control input. However this is not hooked in by default for this PR.

The intention of this PR is more to add the support code to the engine and as a basis for identifying regressions with future dx11/gl changes.

data.title: Basic OpenVR Support
data.body:
Adds basic OpenVR support. This also includes support for rendering controllers based on OpenVR data, though this is as of yet incomplete as there are no hooks for the button input.

Much like the oculus support, a script is also provided to handle setting up control input. However this is not hooked in by default for this PR.

The intention of this PR is more to add the support code to the engine and as a basis for identifying regressions with future dx11/gl changes.

data.title: Added a test physicsShape datablock
data.body: Added a physicsShapeData datablock to use as template and shape test. This will enable an easy way to add a physicsShape from datablock editor. If this test object don't exist, you can't add a new PhysicsShapeData, the new datablock need an object to copy values from. Unless you made the script by hand and then load to your level, but again you need to copies values from somewhere.. new peoples not known this values. This wil help to take down this boundaries. 1) Before you need to compile with bullet or physX 2) Uncomment from art/datablocks/datablockExec.cs `//exec("./physicsShape.cs");` Now you can add with a few clicks a physcisShape 1) Create 2) Edit 3) Add

data.title: Graphic glitches on OpenGL with rain
data.body:
I noticed that there are graphic glitches like lines crossing all over the screen if render mode is OpenGL and there is a precipitation object in the level like rain.
Can anyone confirm this?

data.title: Missing entity.obj while compiling with VS2013 Pro on Windowns 10
data.body:
When I follow the instruction in the tutorial I fail compiling the  "<projectname> DLL" project because of the following error:

> Fehler    133 error LNK1120: 1 nicht aufgelöste Externe  C:\Users\Falke\Google Drive\Workspace.cloud\Software Development\Torque3DTryout\Torque3D\My Projects\Tutorial\game\Tutorial_DEBUG DLL.dll   Tutorial DLL
> 
> Fehler    132 error LNK2019: Verweis auf nicht aufgelöstes externes Symbol ""public: void __thiscall Component::setOwner(class Entity *)" (?setOwner@Component@@QAEXPAVEntity@@@Z)" in Funktion ""public: bool __thiscall Entity::addComponent(class Component *)" (?addComponent@Entity@@QAE_NPAVComponent@@@Z)".   C:...\Torque3D\My Projects\Tutorial\buildFiles\VisualStudio 2012\projects\entity.obj   Tutorial DLL

When I look for entity.obj it is NOT within the path given at the second error message it is withing the build dist directory: 

> C:...\Torque3D\My Projects\Tutorial\buildFiles\Link\VC2010.Debug.Win32\Tutorial DLL\entity.obj

I really tried a lot like comping with vs110 instead of 2013's vs120 and using another template project from the project manager - but always the same issues. I really want to get started but this blocks me for two days now :(

data.title: Fix a few more case sensitivity issues
data.body: Fix a few more case sensitivity issues for Linux.

data.title: Flips the i386 flag to __i386__
data.body: Flips the i386 preprocessor flag to use **i386**, which is apparently more standard.

data.title: Removes an extraneous Namespace usage
data.body: Removes an extraneous Namespace usage on a function declaration that could cause compiler errors.

data.title: adds bitmap coloration to:
data.body: guibitmapctrl, guibitmapbarctrl, guianimbitmapctrl (and guicrosshairhud by way of inheritance)

data.title: new: guiAnimBitmapCtrl
data.body:
- works similar to the particle animation system. feed it x and y for how many frames in a spritesheet, and let her run.

also supports:
either specific frames, a range to play, or a mix (string)
fps specification, (int)
loop, (bool)
pausing, (bool)
reverse (bool)
 play (bool)
and has callbacks for onLoop, onCompleted, and onFrame (index and actual frame passed along)

data.title: Removes the body for the physicsBody's findContact
data.body:
Removes the body for the physicsBody's findContact function until it's ready to be corrected/used with the entity/component stuff.

This corrects an error for PhysX compilation due to unready code being inadvertently added in with the e/c update.
